title: Jurgen Klopp sends message to Liverpool fans regarding fit-again Naby Keita
text:

Jurgen Klopp has told Liverpool fans that they will soon see the best of Naby Keita.

Keita made his first Premier League appearance of the season in the weekend draw with Manchester United .

The Guinean international, a £52million signing from RB Leipzig in 2018, produced an impressive late cameo as Adam Lallana secured a point with a late goal.

Keita played the final 10 minutes at Old Trafford and had a positive impact on proceedings, adding more creativity and dynamism to Klopp’s side.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

(Image: Wyscout SPA)

The 24 year-old managed 37 appearances last term, during an injury-hit debut campaign at Anfield, but now looks to be over the muscle injury suffered in the European Super Cup.

And now he looks set to play a part against Genk in the Champions League on Wednesday night.

Speaking in Belgium on Tuesday evening, when asked about when Keita will be back to 100 per cent, Klopp responded: "When will we see Keita at his best? Soon.

"Naby is one and a half or two weeks in full training around about.

(Image: 2019 Liverpool FC)

"He looks good and that is why he played [against Man Utd]. They all did, that is why we made the changes (Keita, Lallana and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain).

"We made them because we really knew they could have an impact in that game, it was the best news of the whole day at Man Utd.

"Not the result, not the goalscorer, which was nice, but these three guys who are important players for us can perform like this in a game where they don't have rhythm and they don't play that much, that they can perform like this in a game.

"In training, I see it a lot, so that was the best news. It will not be long.”

Liverpool bid to claim just their second Champions League group stage win away from Anfield in 11 outings tonight.

Defeat to Napoli last time out meant that they have won just once in Europe in the group stage - at Maribor two years ago - in 10 group games.
description: Keita came off the bench and produced an impressive cameo against Manchester United on Sunday
